output.conclusion: This course provides a solid foundation in radar and satellite systems, equipping you with the knowledge to understand their principles, applications, and limitations. Further exploration in specific areas like signal processing, antenna design, or remote sensing is highly recommended.
output.introduction: Welcome to the 'Radar and Satellite Systems' course! This intermediate-level course will delve into the fundamental principles, technologies, and applications of radar and satellite systems. We will explore the underlying physics, system architectures, and signal processing techniques used in these fascinating fields.

chapters.description: Overview of radar principles, history, and applications. Basic radar equation and its components. Different types of radar systems (e.g., primary, secondary, Doppler).
Understanding radar signals: pulse width, pulse repetition frequency (PRF), duty cycle. Range and Doppler resolution. Ambiguity function.
Radar antenna parameters: gain, beamwidth, sidelobes. Different types of radar antennas (e.g., parabolic, phased array). Antenna scanning techniques.
Introduction to radar signal processing techniques. Matched filtering for optimal detection. Constant false alarm rate (CFAR) detection.
Principles of MTI radar for detecting moving targets in clutter. Clutter cancellation techniques. Doppler processing.
Introduction to SAR imaging. Principles of aperture synthesis. SAR image formation and processing.

modules.moduleTitle: Radar Signal Processing and Advanced Techniques

chapters.description: Overview of satellite communication and remote sensing systems. Satellite orbits and constellations. Kepler's laws.
Satellite communication link budget. Modulation and multiple access techniques. Earth station design.
Principles of GPS. Signal structure and ranging techniques. GPS error sources and mitigation.
Principles of remote sensing. Electromagnetic spectrum and atmospheric effects. Different types of remote sensing sensors (e.g., optical, infrared, microwave).
Applications of remote sensing in various fields (e.g., agriculture, forestry, environmental monitoring). Image classification and analysis.

chapters.chapterTitle: Future Trends in Radar and Satellite Systems
chapters.description: Emerging technologies and future trends in radar and satellite systems. Space-based radar, small satellites, and advanced signal processing techniques.
